__note__: This is file is autogenerated, do not edit it manually. For more info https://data.aoe4world.com/

data.name: Baochuan
data.description:
Large sailed war vessel armed with broadside cannons.
+ Anti-structure specialist
- Low movement speed

data.name: Battering Ram
data.description:
Durable infantry transport effective against buildings and walls.
+ High ranged armor
+ High health
- Takes bonus damage from melee attacks
- Can only attack buildings
- Slow movement speed

data.name: Bombard
data.description:
Intimidating siege gun excellent against buildings or any stubborn targets.
+ High damage
- Must be set up to fire

data.name: Counterweight Trebuchet
data.description:
Powerful siege engine effective at destroying buildings and walls over a great distance.
+ Bonus damage vs buildings
- Must be set up to fire
- Inaccurate against units

data.name: Crossbowman
data.description:
High damage ranged unit best against heavy targets.
+ Anti-heavy specialist
- Low health
- Countered by Horsemen

data.name: Elite Crossbowman
data.description:
High damage ranged unit best against heavy targets.
+ Anti-heavy specialist
- Low health
- Countered by Horsemen

data.name: Explosive Junk
data.description:
Small ship packed with explosives. Detonates when killed, damaging any units in the area.
- Damage is reduced further from the explosion center
- No weapons other than self-destruction

data.name: Fishing Boat
data.description:
Small boat that gathers Food from either Deep Water Fish or Shoreline Fish. Drops off gathered resources at the Dock.
+ Can repair
- No combat

data.name: Early Grenadier
data.description:
Advanced ranged infantry with thrown explosive canisters that deal damage in a small area.
+ Deals area damage
- Low single target damage
- Slow movement speed

data.name: Grenadier
data.description:
Advanced ranged infantry with thrown explosive canisters that deal damage in a small area.
+ Deals area damage
- Low single target damage
- Slow movement speed

data.name: Horseman
data.description:
Fast cavalry effective at raiding, flanking, and countering ranged units.
+ High movement speed
- Weak against melee units
- Countered by Spearmen

data.name: Veteran Horseman
data.description:
Fast cavalry effective at raiding, flanking, and countering ranged units.
+ High movement speed
- Weak against melee units
- Countered by Spearmen

data.name: Elite Horseman
data.description:
Fast cavalry effective at raiding, flanking, and countering ranged units.
+ High movement speed
- Weak against melee units
- Countered by Spearmen

data.name: Imperial Guard
data.description:
Expensive cavalry with high damage and melee armor. Effective against melee units.
+ Heavy armor
+ Strong in melee combat
- Countered by Spearmen and Crossbowmen

Requires Dynastic Protectors researched at Zhu Xi's Library.

data.name: Imperial Official
data.description:
Economic support unit with no combat capability. Automatically gathers Tax (Gold) from buildings.
+ Can supervise buildings to improve their efficiency
- Only a certain number of Officials can exist at a time

data.name: Junk
data.description:
Oared war vessel armed with a crew of archers.
+ Increased maneuverability
+ Benefits from ranged damage Blacksmith technology

data.name: Lancer
data.description:
Expensive cavalry with high damage and melee armor. Effective against melee units.
+ Heavy armor
+ Strong in melee combat
- Countered by Spearmen and Crossbowmen

data.name: Elite Lancer
data.description:
Expensive cavalry with high damage and melee armor. Effective against melee units.
+ Heavy armor
+ Strong in melee combat
- Countered by Spearmen and Crossbowmen

data.name: Monk
data.description:
Support unit with no combat capability. Can pick up Relics, convert enemy units, and capture Sacred Sites.
+ Heals friendly units
- Slow movement speed

data.name: Nest of Bees
data.description:
Innovative field weapon capable of firing a barrage of rockets to damage defensive positions and clumped enemy troops.
+ Good area of effect damage against most targets
- Slowest movement speed
- Weak if surrounded

data.name: Early Palace Guard
data.description:
Tough infantry with good damage. Move faster than Men-At-Arms, but with reduced armor.
+ Heavy armor
- Countered by Knights, Lancers, and Crossbowmen.

data.name: Palace Guard
data.description:
Tough infantry with good damage. Move faster than Men-At-Arms, but with reduced armor.
+ Heavy armor
- Countered by Knights, Lancers, and Crossbowmen.

data.name: Elite Palace Guard
data.description:
Tough infantry with good damage. Move faster than Men-At-Arms, but with reduced armor.
+ Heavy armor
- Countered by Knights, Lancers, and Crossbowmen.

data.name: Scout
data.description:
Lightly armed cavalry effective at exploring the world, hunting wildlife, and herding Sheep.
+ Able to see into Stealth Forests
+ Health regeneration
+ High movement speed
- Very weak in combat

data.name: Shaolin Monk
data.description:
Monk with strong combat capabilities.
+ Strong against ranged units 
+ Can heal themselves
- Cannot heal others

data.name: Siege Tower
data.description:
Tall infantry transport with no combat capability. Allows garrisoned infantry to be unloaded directly onto Stone Walls.
+ High ranged armor
- Cannot attack
- Slow movement speed

data.name: Spearman
data.description:
Infantry best used against mounted units.
+ Anti-cavalry specialist
+ Additional damage against Elephants
- Weak against heavy infantry
- Countered by Archers

data.name: Hardened Spearman
data.description:
Infantry best used against mounted units.
+ Anti-cavalry specialist
+ Additional damage against Elephants
- Weak against heavy infantry
- Countered by Archers

data.name: Veteran Spearman
data.description:
Infantry best used against mounted units.
+ Anti-cavalry specialist
+ Additional damage against Elephants
- Weak against heavy infantry
- Countered by Archers

data.name: Elite Spearman
data.description:
Infantry best used against mounted units.
+ Anti-cavalry specialist
+ Additional damage against Elephants
- Weak against heavy infantry
- Countered by Archers

data.name: Springald
data.description:
Anti-unit siege weapon. Fires bolts that pierce multiple units.
+ Does not require setup to fire
+ Bonus damage vs. melee infantry
- Trivial damage vs. buildings

data.name: Trade Ship
data.description:
Trade Ships generate Gold and Wood when assigned to a trade route with a Coastal Trade Post or another player's Dock.
- No combat

data.name: Trader
data.description:
Traders generate Gold by travelling between their Home Market and a Trade Post or another player's Market. Greater distances between the Home Market and trade destination will generate higher amounts of Gold.
The Home Market or Trade destination may be changed at any time.

data.name: Transport Ship
data.description:
Large oared vessel able to transport land units across water.
+ Can be garrisoned by any unit
+ Uses sight range of units in garrison
- No combat

data.name: Villager
data.description:
Gathers Wood, Food, Stone, and Gold. Builds and repairs buildings and can repair siege engines and naval units.
- Weak in combat

data.name: War Junk
data.description:
Ship equipped with broadside ballistae.
+ Strong against Arrow Ships
- Lower maneuverability

data.name: Yuan Raider
data.description:
Extremely swift light cavalry which deals bonus damage to economic units.
+ Fast move speed
+ Bonus damage vs Villagers
- Weak in melee combat
- Countered by Spearmen

Requires Dynastic Protectors researched at Zhu Xi's Library.

data.name: Zhuge Nu
data.description:
Fires bolts with a ferocious damage potential against enemy units.
+ High rate of fire
- Ineffective vs high ranged armor targets
- Countered by Horsemen

+ High rate of fire

- Countered by Horsemen
